snippet: Higher payroll taxes and rising gasoline prices slowed retail sales in January, indicating that growth for the first quarter would be modest.
abstract: Higher payroll taxes and rising gasoline prices slow retail sales in January, indicating that growth for first quarter will be modest; Commerce Dept reports retail sales rose 0.1 percent after 0.5 percent rise in December 2012.
lead_paragraph: Higher payroll taxes and rising gasoline prices slowed retail sales in January, indicating that growth for the first quarter would be modest.

headline.seo: Retail Sales Barely Rise, Hinting at Slow Growth
headline.main: Retail Sales Show a Slight Increase
headline.print_headline: Higher Taxes Hold Retail Sales to a Slight Rise
